title: Lyndon–Hochschild–Serre spectral sequence
summary: In mathematics, especially in the fields of group cohomology, homological algebra and number theory, the Lyndon spectral sequence or Hochschild–Serre spectral sequence is a spectral sequence relating the group cohomology of a normal subgroup N and the quotient group G/N to the cohomology of the total group G.  The spectral sequence is named after Roger Lyndon, Gerhard Hochschild, and Jean-Pierre Serre.
